prompt:
Good extraction. Now look at [lids] — it shows 4 Pavisha-branded lids. The BLUE lid in the top-right position is the ACTUAL lid for this jar. It has embossed 'PAVISHA' text and an embossed decorative nature/floral relief pattern on its top surface.

Replace the current lid on the jar with this ACTUAL Pavisha embossed lid from [lids]. The lid should sit naturally on the jar — same diameter, screwed on properly.

Also enhance the photography:
- Add studio three-point lighting: soft key from upper-left, fill from right, STRONG rim/backlight from behind to create dramatic bright edge outlines along both sides of the jar and transmit light through the PET body
- The rim light should make the jar edges GLOW — this is the money shot for clear PET
- Light gray gradient background (#F0F0F0 to #E0E0E0) with a subtle reflective surface beneath showing a soft faded reflection of the jar base
- Soft contact shadow for grounding
- The lid's embossed PAVISHA pattern should be revealed through directional micro-shadows
- Slight 3/4 rotation (10-15°) so we see both the front label AND the lid top surface
- Make the PET transparency the star — light passing through, back-side artwork visible, internal clarity
- Tack sharp everything

Keep the REAL jar body from the previous turn — only replace the lid and enhance the lighting/background. Do NOT regenerate the jar artwork.
